repo_notes.content: This is a comprehensive prompt library for Software Engineering AI Agents. The Wiki provides guidance on prompt design principles, agent workflows, and best practices. Content is based on real-world system prompts, curated patterns from GitHub's AI integration best practices, and professional developer guidelines. Focus on actionable instructions rather than technical implementations of agent systems.

pages.title: SE Agent Engineering Guide
pages.purpose: Introduction to designing system prompts and instructions for AI Agents specialized in Software Engineering. Provides an overview of the prompt library structure, key concepts, and navigation guidance for the Wiki.

page_notes.content: Reference overview.md and README.md files. Include a visual diagram (Mermaid) of the Wiki structure.

pages.title: Prompt Design Fundamentals
pages.purpose: Core principles of prompt engineering for software engineering tasks: persona definition, constraint setting, output format specification, and context management strategies.

pages.title: Persona and Role Definition
pages.purpose: Techniques for defining AI agent personas: Senior Architect, QA Engineer, Security Auditor. How persona choice affects agent behavior and output quality.

page_notes.content: Reference agent files with persona definitions like principal-software-engineer-agent.md, csharp-expert-agent.md.

pages.title: Constraint and Rule Systems
pages.purpose: Establishing constraints for agents: Clean Code principles, SOLID, DRY, and language-specific idioms. Enforcing coding standards through prompt instructions.

pages.title: Output Format Specifications
pages.purpose: Defining output formats: code blocks, diffs, JSON schemas, Mermaid diagrams. Techniques for structured responses and parsing agent outputs.

page_notes.content: Reference AI-assisted JSON Schema Creation and Mapping.md, understanding-openai-functions.md.

pages.title: Architecture and Design Agents
pages.purpose: Designing agents that assist with high-level software architecture: system boundaries, technology selection, trade-off analysis, and architectural decision-making.

pages.title: System Architecture Prompts
pages.purpose: Crafting prompts for generating architectural patterns, C4 diagrams, UML models, and Architectural Decision Records (ADRs).

pages.title: API and Data Flow Design
pages.purpose: Agent instructions for designing APIs (OpenAPI/Swagger), database schemas, event-driven architectures, and state management strategies.

pages.title: Planning and Task Decomposition
pages.purpose: Agents for breaking down complex tasks: epic breakdown, feature decomposition, implementation planning, and test planning strategies.

pages.title: Epic and Feature Breakdown
pages.purpose: Prompts for decomposing large requirements into manageable tasks. PRD generation, user story creation, and acceptance criteria definition.

pages.title: Implementation Planning
pages.purpose: Creating implementation plans from specifications: task sequencing, dependency identification, and milestone definition.

pages.title: Code Implementation Agents
pages.purpose: Best practices for code generation agents: context window management, language-specific idioms, boilerplate vs. business logic generation.

pages.title: Language-Specific Prompts
pages.purpose: Tailored instructions for different programming languages and frameworks: C#/.NET, Python, TypeScript, PowerShell.

pages.title: Test-Driven Development Agents
pages.purpose: TDD workflow agents: Red-Green-Refactor cycle implementation, test scaffolding, and test coverage strategies.

pages.title: Analysis and Quality Assurance
pages.purpose: Configuring agents as code reviewers and QA engineers: static analysis, security auditing, performance profiling, and best practice enforcement.

pages.title: Code Review Agents
pages.purpose: Prompts for automated code review: detecting anti-patterns, code smells, security vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10), and suggesting refactoring improvements.

pages.title: Debugging and Error Analysis
pages.purpose: Debugging workflow agents: stack trace analysis, root cause identification, and patch generation without introducing regressions.

pages.title: Documentation and Knowledge Transfer
pages.purpose: Agents for generating documentation: README files, API docs, code explanations, and knowledge base articles.

pages.title: Code Explanation Techniques
pages.purpose: Prompts for summarizing complex logic into natural language: docstrings, inline comments, and 'Explain Like I'm 5' summaries for stakeholders.

pages.title: AI Agent Tool Ecosystem
pages.purpose: Overview of tools, platforms, and frameworks for AI-assisted development: IDE integrations, MCP servers, and agent platforms.

page_notes.content: Reference Top AI Tools.md, get-started-mcp.md, Agent Skills.md.

pages.title: IDE Integrations
pages.purpose: Instructions for AI agents integrated into development environments: GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Windsurf, VS Code agents.

page_notes.content: Reference Cursor Prompts/, Windsurf/, VSCode Agent/, copilot-custom-instructions.md.

pages.title: Standalone AI Agents
pages.purpose: Prompts and configurations for standalone AI agent platforms: Devin AI, Lovable, Replit, and others.

page_notes.content: Reference Devin AI/, Lovable/, Replit/, Anthropic/ directories.

pages.title: Research and Reasoning Agents
pages.purpose: Agents designed for deep research, critical analysis, and complex reasoning tasks in software engineering contexts.

pages.title: Advanced Reasoning Techniques
pages.purpose: Chain-of-Thought (CoT), Tree-of-Thought, and other advanced prompting techniques for complex problem-solving.

page_notes.content: Reference Chain of Thought Prompting.md, chain-of-thought-prompting.md, zero-shot-learning.md.

pages.title: Safety and Responsible AI
pages.purpose: Best practices for AI safety in software engineering: content filtering, security considerations, and ethical guidelines for agent behavior.
